meanings.definition: The quality or state of being watery.
meanings.sent1: The waterinesses of the soup made it too thin.
meanings.sent2: The lake's waterinesses were evident in its clear blue color.
meanings.sent3: The waterinesses of the rain made everyone run for cover.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes shimmered with the waterinesses of unshed tears.
meanings.sent5: The waterinesses of the drink left a refreshing sensation on his tongue.

meanings.definition: The presence of water or a watery substance.
meanings.sent1: The waterinesses in the glass indicated it had just been washed.
meanings.sent2: The waterinesses of the river attracted many birds to its banks.
meanings.sent3: The waterinesses of the fountain made it a favorite spot for children to play.
meanings.sent4: The waterinesses of the ocean seemed to stretch endlessly into the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The waterinesses of the raindrops created a soothing sound on the roof.
